Class ArmBotEasy

java.lang.Object
MRILib.managers.Bot
MRILib.managers.ArmBotEasy
public class ArmBotEasy extends Bot
Extends the base Bot class to include specific hardware and control logic for a robot arm mechanism consisting of a slide, pivot, and claw assembly. Provides methods for controlling the arm components and reading their states. Assumes specific hardware names ("slide", "pivot", "clawPitch", "claw_roll", "claw").
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ArmBotEasy

      public ArmBotEasy(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hm)
      Constructor for ArmBotEasy. Initializes the base Bot functionalities and the specific arm motors and servos.
      Parameters:
      hm - The HardwareMap from the OpMode, used to retrieve hardware devices.

  • Method Details

    • initMotors

      private void initMotors(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hm)
      Initializes the slide and pivot motors. Retrieves them from the hardware map, sets their direction, and resets encoders. Sets the initial RunMode to STOP_AND_RESET_ENCODER.
      Parameters:
      hm - The HardwareMap to retrieve motors from.

    • initServos

      private void initServos(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hm)
      Initializes the claw, claw pitch, and claw roll servos. Retrieves them from the hardware map.
      Parameters:
      hm - The HardwareMap to retrieve servos from.

    • setArmMode

      public void setArmMode(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor.RunMode mode)
      Sets the DcMotor.RunMode for both the slide and pivot motors simultaneously. Useful for switching between modes like RUN_USING_ENCODER and RUN_TO_POSITION.
      Parameters:
      mode - The desired DcMotor.RunMode.

    • resetEncoders

      public void resetEncoders()
      Resets the encoders for all drive motors (via superclass) and the arm motors (slide, pivot). This sets the current position of these motors to 0 without changing their RunMode.
      Overrides:
      resetEncoders in class Bot
      See Also:
      • Bot.resetEncoders()

    • updateEncoders

      public void updateEncoders()
      Updates the stored encoder positions for all drive motors (via superclass) and the arm motors (slide, pivot). Stores the previous values as well. This should be called periodically (e.g., in the loop) to get fresh encoder readings.
      Overrides:
      updateEncoders in class Bot
      See Also:
      • Bot.updateEncoders()

    • getSlideMotor

      public com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotorEx getSlideMotor()
      Gets the slide motor instance.
      Returns:
      The DcMotorEx object for the slide.

    • getPivotMotor

      public com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotorEx getPivotMotor()
      Gets the pivot motor instance.
      Returns:
      The DcMotorEx object for the pivot.

    • getSlidePos

      public int getSlidePos()
      Gets the last updated encoder position of the slide motor. Call updateEncoders() beforehand for the latest value.
      Returns:
      The slide motor's encoder position.

    • getPivotPos

      public int getPivotPos()
      Gets the last updated encoder position of the pivot motor. Call updateEncoders() beforehand for the latest value.
      Returns:
      The pivot motor's encoder position.

    • getClawPitch

      public com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.Servo getClawPitch()
      Gets the claw pitch servo instance.
      Returns:
      The Servo object for the claw pitch.

    • getClawRoll

      public com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.Servo getClawRoll()
      Gets the claw roll servo instance.
      Returns:
      The Servo object for the claw roll.

    • getClaw

      public com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.Servo getClaw()
      Gets the main claw grip servo instance.
      Returns:
      The Servo object for the claw grip.

    • getClawPitchPos

      public double getClawPitchPos()
      Gets the current commanded position of the claw pitch servo. Note: This returns the last commanded position, not necessarily the physical position if the servo is still moving.
      Returns:
      The claw pitch servo position (typically 0.0 to 1.0).

    • getClawRollPos

      public double getClawRollPos()
      Gets the current commanded position of the claw roll servo.
      Returns:
      The claw roll servo position (typically 0.0 to 1.0).

    • getClawPos

      public double getClawPos()
      Gets the current commanded position of the main claw grip servo.
      Returns:
      The claw grip servo position (typically 0.0 to 1.0).

    • setClawPitch

      public void setClawPitch(double pos)
      Sets the target position for the claw pitch servo.
      Parameters:
      pos - The target position (typically 0.0 to 1.0).

    • setClawRoll

      public void setClawRoll(double pos)
      Sets the target position for the claw roll servo.
      Parameters:
      pos - The target position (typically 0.0 to 1.0).

    • setClaw

      public void setClaw(double pos)
      Sets the target position for the main claw grip servo.
      Parameters:
      pos - The target position (typically 0.0 to 1.0).

    • setPivot

      public void setPivot(int target)
      Sets the pivot motor to run to a specific target encoder position. Switches the motor mode to DcMotor.RunMode.RUN_TO_POSITION and sets a default velocity.
      Parameters:
      target - The target encoder position for the pivot motor.

    • setSlides

      public void setSlides(int target)
      Sets the slide motor to run to a specific target encoder position. Switches the motor mode to DcMotor.RunMode.RUN_TO_POSITION and sets a default velocity.
      Parameters:
      target - The target encoder position for the slide motor.

    • setArm

      public void setArm(int pivotTarget, int slideTarget)
      Convenience method to set both the pivot and slide motors to run to target positions simultaneously. Calls setPivot(int) and setSlides(int).
      Parameters:
      pivotTarget - The target encoder position for the pivot motor.
      slideTarget - The target encoder position for the slide motor.
